mdRecord.dcterms:title: Pill press mold
mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: The Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Perforated plate and base, used for making tablets or pills. A compounded mixture would be spread across the perforated plate, filling the holes. After any excess material was removed, the perforated plate would be slid onto the base, removing the newly-formed tablets.
Photographed by Claude Moore Health Sciences Library, Historical Collections and Services staff.
mdRecord.dcterms:isPartOf: The University of Virginia Medical Artifacts Collection
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Medical instruments or apparatus--Pharmaceutical technology
